title: Projects
text: Welcome! This page contains an expanding list of my past work, articles, reports, presentations, and professional projects.

title: Projects
text:
Predicting Art Prices at Auction
Art prices at auctions experience fluctuations that are may seem random but do have some basis behind them. The objective of this project is to use machine learning models to predict art price to discern a pattern of which factors influence art prices more.
See More

title: Projects
text:
S&P 500 Stock Market Analysis
While health crises, geopolitical uncertainty, inflation, and more in recent years have contributed to more uncertainty in the stock market in recent years, the S&P 500 remains strong. The goal of this project was to analyze the trends of the S&P 500 in the past few years to determine which aspects of it are still an attractive investment.
See More

title: Projects
text:
League of Legends Rank Prediction
Although traditional machine learning models excel on tabular data, a major impetus for this project was to determine if neural networks can deliver similar results. The main objective is to use neural networks such as TabTransformer to see how well it would perform on tabular data such as in predicting ranks in video games such as League of Legends.
See More

title: Projects
section: The State of Lobbying in Los Angeles
text:
The State of Lobbying in Los Angeles
Lobbying is a primary determinant of influence for any city, and the millions of dollars spent on lobbying by individuals and companies each year in Los Angeles is a major indicator of not only where the city may see itself in the future in terms of development, but how the city mediates between different interests that have competing visions for the future of Los Angeles. Our goal in this presentation is to determine how the current state of lobbying in Los Angeles functions in relationship to the interests of Los Angeles residents.
See More

title: Projects
text:
Suspicious Activity Email Notifier
Millions of accounts are leaked every year through the many data breaches that companies and government agencies face. Our goal in this presentation is to create a machine learning model that is able to best mitigate the risk of an unauthorized login attempt based on past user behavior.
See More

title: Projects
text:
Used Car Price Analysis
The process of selecting a used car is a more thorough and stringent process for some. In this report, which details the used car market in India, vehicles from different brands, components, number of owners, and other factors are all assessed to determine which factors are more important when it comes to buyers selecting a used car.
See More

title: About Me
text:
I am a statistics and data science major and history minor at UCLA. I have a more human-oriented approach when it comes to analyzing data, as oftentimes metrics collected and aggregated in databases may not always reflect the ground reality of many different company services.
My current focus for business applications is in data engineering, data analysis, and data science. It is crucial to have a solid foundation in these three domains because they form the backbone of the entire data science workflow (CRISP-DM).

title: About Me
text:
Profile

I am passionate about data science/engineering, machine learning/AI, and history. I have experience with programming languages such as SQL, Python, C++ and R, as well as with business intelligence tools such as Tableau and PowerBI. I have also used data containerization and orchestration tools such as Docker and Kubernetes in the past.
My personal research focuses on bridging certain topics from history with the use of methods from data science and machine learning. These include using machine learning models to perform price prediction of fine art on the art auction market and utilizing computer vision to decipher ancient scrolls.
